Articles.Content:
It might very well be just me, but upon loading up KSP today... The suit of the Kerbal in the menu looks... Different?

In particular, the stripes on his helmet seem redder than before...

I don't know... It might be nothing but it just kinda caught me off-guard...

I don't think so.

Image from 0.16:

Image from 0.23.5:

The game refused to give me the same start-up menu as the screenshot I found (on Google, not taken from the game myself) so it's not a direct comparison, but it doesn't look any different. Maybe you've adjusted your screen brightness or something.
What's up with your Kerbin, though? Is that a Kethane map?

Yes, that's Kethane doing that, an outdated version I haven't got round to replacing.

It might not do that any more

EDIT: @katateochi

Thanks

Edited April 11, 2014 by Epthelyn

I don't think they've changed. Did you update your graphics or tweak some settings OP?

@Epthelyn I think by default the current kethane still does that, but you can disbale it by editing the settings.cfg in the Kethane folder and adding ShowInMenu = False
They have your flag now on the backpack for example but I don`t know when that happened.
The flags on Kerbals and certain ship parts (right-click in VAB and select Toggle Flag) was added in 0.23.5, if I recall rightly.

The flags on Kerbals and certain ship parts (right-click in VAB and select Toggle Flag) was added in 0.23.5, if I recall rightly.

Indeed it was!

The flags on Kerbals and certain ship parts (right-click in VAB and select Toggle Flag) was added in 0.23.5, if I recall rightly.

That's probably what was bugging me...

But the red stripes on the helmet do appear more expressed...
I like the new suits. I really like seeing my flag everywhere although I`d like different designs for my flag and what gets plastered all over everything like a logo.

I think they have normal maps on the suits now IIRC.

EDIT: I thought you were referring to the pic above.

I think they have normal maps on the suits now IIRC.

EDIT: I thought you were referring to the pic above.

No, it's the suits in general, since they are using the same models...

In any case, it appears to just be my imagination...
